00075 #include <limits.h>
00076 #include "thread.h"
00077 #include "stats.h"
00078 #include "options.h"
00079 #include "zesto-opts.h"
00080 #include "zesto-cache.h"
00081 #include "zesto-dram.h"
00082 #include "zesto-uncore.h"
00083 
00084 /* Many of the DRAM variables are global and not replicated on a per-core
00085    basis since we assume a single memory interface for the entire multi-core
00086    chip. */
00087 
00088 /* this pointer hold DRAM implementation/model-specific state */
00089 class dram_t * dram = NULL;
00090 
00091 static char * dram_opt_string = NULL;
00092 
00093 void  
00094 dram_reg_options(struct opt_odb_t * const odb)
00095 {
00096   opt_reg_string(odb, "-dram", "dram configuration string",
00097       &dram_opt_string,/*default */"simplescalar:80",/*print*/true,/*format*/NULL);
00098 }
00099 
00100 
00101 void dram_t::init(void)
00102 {
00103   total_accesses = 0;
00104   total_latency = 0;
00105   best_latency = 0;
00106   worst_latency = 0;
00107   total_burst = 0;
00108 }
00109 
00110 dram_t::dram_t(void)
00111 {
00112   init();
00113 }
00114 
00115 dram_t::~dram_t()
00116 {
00117 }
00118 
00119 void dram_t::refresh(void)
00120 {
00121 }
00122 
00123 void dram_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00124 {
00125   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, "dram.total_access", "total number of memory accesses", &total_accesses, /* initial value */0, /* format */NULL);
00126   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, "dram.total_latency", "total memory latency cycles", &total_latency, /* initial value */0, /* format */NULL);
00127   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, "dram.average_latency","average memory latency in cycles",
00128       "dram.total_latency / dram.total_access",/* format */NULL);
00129   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, "dram.best_latency", "fastest memory latency observed", &best_latency, /* initial value */INT_MAX, /* format */NULL);
00130   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, "dram.worst_latency", "worst memory latency observed", &worst_latency, /* initial value */0, /* format */NULL);
00131   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, "dram.total_burst", "total memory burst lengths", &total_burst, /* initial value */0, /* format */NULL);
00132   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, "dram.average_burst","average memory burst length", "dram.total_burst / dram.total_access",/* format */NULL);
00133 }
00134 
00135 
00136 #define DRAM_ACCESS_HEADER \
00137   unsigned int access(const enum cache_command cmd, const md_paddr_t baddr, const int bsize)
00138 #define DRAM_REFRESH_HEADER \
00139   void refresh(void)
00140 #define DRAM_REG_STATS_HEADER \
00141   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00142 
00143 
00144 /* include all of the DRAM definitions */
00145 #include "ZCOMPS-dram.list"
00146 
00147 static dram_t * dram_from_string(char * const opt_string)
00148 {
00149   char type[256];
00150 
00151   /* the format string "%[^:]" for scanf reads a string consisting of non-':' characters */
00152   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%[^:]",type) != 1)
00153     fatal("malformed dram option string: %s",opt_string);
00154 
00155   /* include the argument parsing code.  DRAM_PARSE_ARGS is defined to
00156      include only the parsing code and not the other dram code. */
00157 #define DRAM_PARSE_ARGS
00158 #include "ZCOMPS-dram.list"
00159 #undef DRAM_PARSE_ARGS
00160 
00161   /* UNKNOWN DRAM Type */
00162   fatal("Unknown dram type (%s)",opt_string);
00163 }
00164 
00165 void dram_create(void)
00166 {
00167   dram = dram_from_string(dram_opt_string);
00168 }
